metadata.name: History File Deletion
metadata.comment: Detects events in which a history file gets deleted, e.g. the ~/bash_history to remove traces of malicious activity

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND ((endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/rm')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/unlink')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/shred'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/.bash_history')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/.zsh_history'))) AND (endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('_history')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.history')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('zhistory'))))

output.summary: Detects events in which a history file gets deleted, e.g. the ~/bash_history to remove traces of malicious activity

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activities References: https://github.com/sleventyeleven/linuxprivchecker/, https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1552.003/T1552.003.md
